instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00431: What is 820-00431? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
IMac a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 
1 led diagnostic lights

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Schematic and boardview here:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YwbI5L7bD9K2w0LzdrDuu88PHcukPXka/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> (at same time).
Use J5120 pads, instead of power button.

threads.message: buongiorno scusa ma sono un p√≤ alle prime armi su alcune misure potresti spiegarmi come posso fare la misura che mi hai indicato?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: good morning sorry but I'm a little beginner on some measurements could you explain to me how I can do the measurement you indicated?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
Read this thread first:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
Find any test point, or component connected to <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>, to check the pulse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
ok correct me if I'm wrong I connect with a wire j5120 pin 1-pin2,
and then I measure <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R1885</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: As in the thread explained, just temporar contact; similar as pressing power button...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: I have tested with your info and i found on datasheet the two pin. I have put just temporar contact and after tested the <RESISTOR>R1885</RESISTOR> voltage 3,45  <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: You must check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> [U]at same time[/U] when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
When the button is pressed, there is no pulse on the <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>
 voltage remains constant at 3.5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
This points to SMC issue.

Do you get 12MHz at Y5165?
If no o-scope available, post DC voltage on its pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
press smc on-off  
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> 3,45v -0,12 v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: Check if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> pulses at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
press smc on-off
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>  3,31v - 0,00v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
When press the power button, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> should go high, from 0V to 3V; not viceversa.
Do you get high <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> when the power is applied, before pressing power button?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: yes before press smc on/ off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
That's good, means the power on sequence starts when the power is connected.
Do you get S3 voltages too, when <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is high?

Also check <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> and S0 voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: ok ok could you tell me specifically which voltage to check S0?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
Page 68 shows you the S0 enables signals.
Just follow each of them and check the corresponding power rails.

First confirm <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> presence, of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> 3,31v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: Then do what I said; locate the S0 voltages, as above indicated.
